scenes.goal: Introduce recursion as a problem-solving technique
visual_elements: Simple diagram of a function calling itself
Icon of a mirror reflecting itself
scenes.narrative_intent: Define recursion and present the core idea of a function calling itself to solve a problem.

visual_elements: Flowchart node labeled 'Base Case' with a green checkmark
scenes.narrative_intent: Emphasize that every recursive solution needs a base case to prevent infinite recursion.

visual_elements: Text: 'Recursive Step: Reduce the problem size'
scenes.narrative_intent: Show how the recursive step moves the problem toward the base case.

visual_elements: Arrow showing push and pop operations
scenes.narrative_intent: Illustrate how the call stack builds during recursion and unwinds when the base case is reached.

visual_elements: Code for factorial using recursion and a for-loop
Complexity labels: O(n) time, O(n) space vs O(n) time, O(1) space
scenes.narrative_intent: Highlight similarities and differences, including trade-offs in readability and memory usage.

visual_elements: Warning icon with text: 'Missing base case'
Stack overflow animation with growing stack
Checklist: Define base case, ensure progress, consider tail recursion
scenes.narrative_intent: Warn about infinite recursion and stack overflow, and suggest strategies to avoid them.
